title: Rustc shows unnecessary big error when glob reexport failed

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
pub const ITEM: Item = Item;

pub struct Item;

pub fn item() {}

// Glob (*) is required to cause the error
pub use doesnt_exist::*;

mod a {
    use crate::{item, Item, ITEM};
}

mod b {
    use crate::item;
    use crate::Item;
    use crate::ITEM;
}

mod c {
    use crate::item;
}
```
([play](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=d7d38220140a6793756d30e20fdbdc22))


I expected to see an error that only says that "`doesnt_exist` is unresolved".

But the error says that all uses of items from the module with glob import (`crate` in this case) are unresolved too:

```text
error[E0432]: unresolved imports `doesnt_exist`, `crate::item`, `crate::Item`, `crate::ITEM`, `crate::item`, `crate::Item`, `crate::ITEM`, `crate::item`
  --> src/lib.rs:41:9
   |
41 | pub use doesnt_exist::*;
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `doesnt_exist`
...
44 |     use crate::{item, Item, ITEM};
   |                 ^^^^  ^^^^  ^^^^
...
48 |     use crate::item;
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^
49 |     use crate::Item;
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^
50 |     use crate::ITEM;
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^
...
54 |     use crate::item;
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^
```

This may lead to extremely long and unreadable errors. The issue was originally found while developing `teloxide` where it caused [1500+ lines error](https://gist.github.com/WaffleLapkin/0283b070e38fed0affdf5b787b0010d3).
